description:
Persist JavaScript dialog state across page navigations.

This prevents a single WebContents from annoying the user with JavaScript alert loops, no matter what the page does in-between (e.g. reload, switch sites).

BUG=265475
TEST=as in bug
TBR=mnaganov@chromium.org

Committed: https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=214697

messages.text: PTAL; I see this as a good solution that fixes both reloads and navigation loops.

lgtm

should we update the UI string to make it clear that this suppresses further dialogs from the current tab?

On 2013/07/30 06:32:22, jochen wrote:
> lgtm
> 
> should we update the UI string to make it clear that this suppresses further
> dialogs from the current tab?

You mean "Prevent this page from creating additional dialogs." -> "Prevent this tab from creating additional dialogs."? It's technically more correct, but if this new code is triggered, then it's being triggered by something nasty that the page is doing, and I feel this is still correct enough.

On 2013/07/30 14:38:01, Avi wrote:
> On 2013/07/30 06:32:22, jochen wrote:
> > lgtm
> > 
> > should we update the UI string to make it clear that this suppresses further
> > dialogs from the current tab?
> 
> You mean "Prevent this page from creating additional dialogs." -> "Prevent this
> tab from creating additional dialogs."? It's technically more correct, but if
> this new code is triggered, then it's being triggered by something nasty that
> the page is doing, and I feel this is still correct enough.
